text: One thing that is really helpful in learning Python is to use the interactive help function:

code:
>>> help(["foo", "bar", "baz"])
Help on list object:

class list(object)
 ...

 |
 |  index(...)
 |      L.index(value, [start, [stop]]) -> integer -- return first index of value
 |

text: which will often lead you to the method you are looking for.
index() returns the first index of value!

code:
def all_indices(value, qlist):
    indices = []
    idx = -1
    while 1:
        try:
            idx = qlist.index(value, idx+1)
            indices.append(idx)
        except ValueError:
            break
    return indices

all_indices("foo", ["foo","bar","baz","foo"])
